meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise
meanings.sent1: The thunder blatters outside the window.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks blatters in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The old car blatters like a broken drum.
meanings.sent4: The wind blatters against the house like an angry giant.
meanings.sent5: The drum blatters a rhythm that echoes through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The blatters of the thunder shook the windows.
meanings.sent2: The blatters of the fireworks filled the air.
meanings.sent3: The blatters of the old piano made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The blatters of the waterfall drowned out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: The blatters of the drum reverberated through the room.

meanings.definition: To talk rapidly and continuously in a foolish or trivial way
meanings.sent1: She blatters on about her favorite TV show.
meanings.sent2: He blatters nonstop about his new video game.
meanings.sent3: The parrot blatters nonsense all day long.
meanings.sent4: Her mind blatters with random thoughts like a popcorn machine.
meanings.sent5: The radio blatters on in the background, filling the silence.
